column4: Hey guys, I'm trying to call an application via terminal (Sublime Text to be exact). What would be the best way to do that? Sublime Text is in /opt/Sublime Text 2/sublime_text.exe
.exe - are you calling this with wine?
No, I was just trying to add it to terminal.
I'm not sure what mono is, but I can double click it and it will launch Sublime.
I'll have to type that in every time I want to launch sublime from the command line?
no, that will tell you/me what that file is
It said no such file or dir
ok change to the directory then "cd /opt/Sublime\ Text" then "file sublime_text.exe" or did you just make that path up?

I ran it w/o the .exe and it returned: /opt/Sublime Text 2/sublime_text: ELF 32-bit LSB executable, Intel 80386, version 1 (SYSV), dynamically linked (uses shared libs), for GNU/Linux 2.6.15, stripped
so it's NOT an .exe - that makes more sense
so what do you want to do with it?  man a menu entry?
not exactly - the problem is you'd have to be in the same directory as index.html - just add the /opt/Sublime\ Text\ 2 to your PATH - .bashrc can be used for this.
you won't need the \ when you add it to your PATH (i don't think)
you edit the .bashrc, it's not a command
looks like Dr_Willis found that in .profile not .bashrc
